thread.title: Ryan Seacrest may finally be getting his college degree
thread.title_full: Ryan Seacrest may finally be getting his college degree | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Janel Davis
title: Ryan Seacrest may finally be getting his college degree
text:
Entertainment mogul Ryan Seacrest is a step away from getting the one thing that he has not yet received: a college degree.
Seacrest, originally from Dunwoody, Georgia, attended The University of Georgia as a journalism major but dropped out of the state’s flagship institution before completing his degree years ago to begin his career in Hollywood.
>> Read more trending stories
Now, UGA is requesting an honorary degree for Seacrest.
A committee of Georgia’s Board of Regents approved the degree Tuesday during the group’s monthly meeting. The full board still has to vote on the degree Wednesday.
In addition to his work in entertainment, including hosting “American Idol” and creating and producing television programs such as “Keeping Up With the Kardashians” and “Jaime Oliver’s Food Revolution,” Seacrest works with hospitalized children through the Ryan Seacrest Foundation. The nonprofit organization builds Seacrest Studios– broadcast media centers– in pediatric hospitals in cities across the nation, including Atlanta, Boston and Philadelphia. The studios to allow patients and their families to experience radio and television broadcasting.
UGA President Jere Morehead said Seacrest is expected to be the school’s undergraduate commencement speaker in May.
